description: Dive into "Picture Perfect Lyon: Capture the City" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Picture Perfect Lyon: Capture the City

places.generalDescription: Parc de la T√™te d'Or is a vast 19th-century park located in Lyon, France. It features statues, fountains, tall trees, a lake, and botanic and rose gardens. The park offers the charming Le Petit du Parc de la Tete d'Or miniature train ride through lush gardens. Visitors can admire stunning flora and fauna while exploring hidden nooks and crannies or simply enjoying the gentle breeze and warm sunshine.

sources.snippet: V√©ritable poumon de la ville, on aime y aller en tout temps que ce soit pour peaufiner notre bronzage l‚Äô√©t√©, admirer les jolies couleurs de l‚Äôautomne, s‚Äôentretenir durant l‚Äôhiver et regarder la nature reprendre ses droits au printemps. Finalement, que ce soit pour aller y faire notre footing ou chiler le week-end lorsqu‚Äôon ne sait pas quoi faire, le parc de la T√™te d‚ÄôOr est ind√©niablement notre endroit favori √† Lyon. Si l‚Äôenvie vous prend d‚Äôaller d√©couvrir ce havre de paix, on vous recommande fortement d‚Äôaller faire un tour du c√¥t√© du lac, de la roseraie, du jardin botanique et du parc zoologique.
sources.shortName: Lyon : nos 10 spots photos favoris

sources.snippet: A little way north of the centre is one of the largest urban parks in the country, with a zoo and France‚Äôs foremost botanical garden within its boundaries. If you‚Äôre around in spring then the international rose garden should be one of your first ports of call in the city. The botanical attractions are spectacular too, with more than 20,000 plant varieties and the most graceful 19th-century greenhouses you could hope to see, thick with the scent of chlorophyll.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Lyon (France)

sources.snippet: The Parc de la T√™te d'Or was named for a golden statue of Christ that, according to legend, was buried here by Crusaders. Nestled on the left bank of the Rh√¥ne River, this luxuriant park is a haven of tranquility in the heart of the city. The park has a zoo, an eight-hectare botanical garden, and a rose garden with heirloom varieties.
sources.shortName: Attractions & Places to Visit in Lyon

sources.snippet: For a break from the city‚Äôs hustle and bustle, head to Parc de la T√™te d‚ÄôOr. This expansive park covers over 290 acres and is the perfect spot for a picnic, bike ride, or leisurely stroll. (I‚Äôm a big fan of picnics!)
sources.shortName: 21 Best Lyon Instagram Spots: Perfect Lyon Photos (2025)

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre visiting the Roseraie de Concours you should explore the rest of Parc de la T√™te d‚ÄôOr. It‚Äôs full of giant green spaces, tree-covered paths, and tranquil lakes. There‚Äôs even a sculpture garden.
sources.shortName: 22 Captivating Lyon Instagram Spots (2025)

places.name: Parc de la T√™te d'Or

reviews.text: On a sunny day in Lyon, there's no better escape than the Parc de la T√™te d'Or-a sprawling green paradise that feels like the city's happy soul. Whether you're lounging by the sparkling lake, wandering through rose gardens in full bloom, or watching turtles sunbathe near the botanical gardens, the whole park radiates good vibes. Locals and visitors alike picnic, bike, and bask under the trees, while kids giggle near the carousel and the surprisingly charming zoo. It's the kind of place where time slows down and simple joys-like ice cream in the sun or a quiet stroll-feel totally magical. Pure Lyonnaise bliss!

Big park in the heart of Lyon and close to Central railway. We have free morning time around 1 hour and choose this park walking around.
- Lake and duck is funny and beautiful nature, we love this
- Flower garden is nice but June summer time bit too hot for grew.
- Deer ü¶å in the outside part was cute

Fantastic Park and is absolutely massive.
We didn't realise the scale and size of it until we took the little train tour around it which was over 20 minutes and stopped twice.
There is a large outdoor zoo space boat pedal bikes, botanical Gardens and loads of stop offs for ice cream.
You could genuinely spend all day there and would have a great time. Very fun and close to the bus stops for local bus back to the train station.

places.generalDescription: The Basilica of Notre Dame of Fourvi√®re is a 19th-century religious monument in Lyon, France. It features four octagonal towers and houses a museum showcasing religious art. Regular Catholic services are held at the basilica. Visitors can enjoy a romantic evening in Lyon by staying at the Boudoir Spa, which offers luxurious accommodations with amenities such as a Jacuzzi and hammam, providing an ideal setting for special occasions or simply spending quality time together.

sources.snippet: This magnificent church, ever visible on the Fourvi√®re hill to west of the city is one of a series of iconic hill-top churches built in major French cities in the late-19th century. The basilica is in the oldest part of the city, Lyon‚Äôs pilgrimage site and where several Roman sites have been discovered. Go inside to see the extravagant interiors and the Museum of Sacred Art, and to ascend the north tower for one of Lyon‚Äôs best photo ops.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Lyon (France)

sources.snippet: Despite the tragic fire in 2019, Notre-Dame Cathedral remains an architectural marvel and a symbol of resilience. While the cathedral undergoes restoration, you can still capture its timeless beauty from the exterior, showcasing its stunning Gothic architecture and intricate facades. For a picture-perfect moment, stroll along the banks of the Seine River and capture the cathedral‚Äôs reflection in the water.
sources.shortName: Instagram Photo Spots in Paris

sources.snippet: Dominating Lyon‚Äôs ‚ÄúHill of Prayer,‚Äù the Fourvi√®re, the Basilica of Notre-Dame de Fourvi√®re was built in the late 19th century from a design by architect Pierre Bossan. he architecture of the church is unique in that it has both Byzantine and Romanesque styles. In addition to four corner towers rising over the structure, the basilica features a bell tower with a golden statue of the Virgin Mary.
sources.shortName: 18 Top Tourist Attractions in Lyon, France (+Map)

sources.snippet: The Basilica of Fourvi√®re is certainly the most famous and iconic monument of Lyon. Located at the top of Fourvi√®re Hill, it is also one of the greatest places from where you can admire Lyon. Three places around the basilica are worth a glimpse : the esplanade near the basilica, the little square in the middle of Jardin du Rosaire, and the tiny square located in Mont√©e du Chemin Neuf.
sources.shortName: The 5 Best views and viewpoints in Lyon, France ‚Äì where to take incredible photos of sunrise and sunset

sources.snippet: The Basilique Notre-Dame de Fourviere with its harmonious blend of neo-Gothic and neo-Byzantine styles. The Basilica, thanks to its location on the top of a hill, towers solemnly over the city. The peculiarity of its construction is that the temple consists of two parts: upper and lower.
sources.shortName: Top 30 places to visit in Lyon in 2024 (Lots of photos)

sources.snippet: Still little-known (which is a very good thing), this small secluded garden offers a commanding view over the city. The Opera House, Place Bellecour and Confluence, as well as thousands of red and ochre roofs, stretch out beneath your eyes.
sources.shortName: Lyon‚Äôs best viewpoints - Lyon Tourist Office

sources.snippet: From a photography point of view, Lyon can be visited year round. That said, Lyon being a big city, it is better to come during the times when the pollution is the lowest for cityscapes, that is from late autumn to mid spring.
sources.shortName: The 30 best photo spots in Lyon in 2025

sources.snippet: Fourvi√®re Basilica sits atop Fourvi√®re hill overlooking Vieux Lyon (Lyon‚Äôs Old District). No matter where I was in Lyon, this incredible white church stood out. And, from the moment I saw it, I knew I had to see its interior.
sources.shortName: 22 Captivating Lyon Instagram Spots (2025)
Old Lyon Neighborhood - Best Photo Spots

places.name: Basilica of Notre Dame of Fourvi√®re

reviews.text: You can see the Basilica from almost everywhere in the Lyon old town but it is well worth heading up to see it up close. Take the funicular (walking back down is nice) to get there. The Basilica is in such lovely condition. The murals look amazing and there is a real sense of peacefulness. Make sure you take the time to look closely at the murals. My favourite was the one depicting Joan of Arc. We went on a Saturday morning and it wasn't too busy. We didn't have to wait to go in. It is free to visit. There is a lovely courtyard next to the Basilica where you get some amazing views over Lyon.

A very impressive church with beautiful architecture.  At the top of the hill so I recommend getting the cable car up for a few euro. The view is amazing as well. Was a very hot day and that affected our focus and interest in staying long but took a lot of photos of the inside as it looked beautiful.

If you enjoy walking, the uphill trek takes about 30 minutes, while the return downhill stroll is around 20. The route winds through a peaceful, tree-lined path that's absolutely worth taking-it adds a touch of nature to the experience. Not feeling up for the climb? No worries! The funicular offers a convenient and charming alternative.

places.generalDescription: Cath√©drale Saint-Jean-Baptiste is a grand medieval cathedral located in the Renaissance quarter of Vieux Lyon. It features an astronomical clock and stunning stained-glass windows, as well as a treasury museum. Visitors can reach the cathedral by walking through medieval alleys or taking a funicular string with excellent views over the city.

sources.snippet: Another must-see attraction in Lyon is the Cathedral Saint Jean-Baptiste, located in the historic district of Saint-Jean. You will certainly pass by it as you are exploring Vieux Lyon, as it is centrally located and very hard to miss!. Place Saint-Jean is popular as a meeting point for Lyon tour groups.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Lyon Instagram Spots: Perfect Lyon Photos (2025)

sources.snippet: What looks to be a miniature version of the Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris is actually the Saint Jean-Baptise Cathedral in Lyon. The astronomical clock inside is uniquely impressive, and it still tells the time. That‚Äôll serve you when you‚Äôre trying to get from each Instagram Lyon hotspot to the next.
sources.shortName: The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Lyon

sources.snippet: Built in the 12th-century, the magnificent Cathedral of Saint-John is renowned for its 13th- to 14th-century stained-glass windows. The large rose window dating from 1392 allows in a kaleidoscope of colorful light. The cathedral is mainly Romanesque with a Late Gothic facade.
sources.shortName: Attractions & Places to Visit in Lyon

sources.snippet: This specific neighborhood is on the East of the Saone river at the "Vieux Lyon" metro station, around the "Cathedrale Saint-Jean".
sources.shortName: Old Lyon Neighborhood - Best Photo Spots

places.name: Cath√©drale Saint-Jean-Baptiste

reviews.text:
The Cath√©drale Saint-Jean-Baptiste in Lyon is a remarkable blend of spiritual significance and historical grandeur. Situated in the heart of Vieux Lyon, this cathedral is not only an architectural masterpiece but also houses one of the most fascinating timepieces in Europe: the Lyon Astronomical Clock.

Construction of the cathedral began in 1180 and was completed in 1476, showcasing a harmonious blend of Romanesque and Gothic styles. As the seat of the Archbishop of Lyon, it has been central to the city's religious life for centuries. The cathedral's fa√ßade and interior are adorned with intricate details that reflect its historical importance .

One of the cathedral's most captivating features is its astronomical clock, a 9-meter-tall marvel dating back to the 14th century. Reconstructed in 1661 by Guillaume Nourrisson after its destruction in 1562, the clock is a testament to medieval engineering and artistry . Ôøº Ôøº

The clock's intricate mechanism includes an astrolabe that indicates the date and positions of celestial bodies, as well as a perpetual calendar accurate until the year 3008 . Its automata perform a daily show at noon, 2 PM, 3 PM, and 4 PM, featuring figures like angels striking bells and a rooster crowing .

The cathedral was a welcome surprise during our visit to Lyon. Despite not being as well known as some of the other cathedrals in France, it did not fail to amaze. The architecture is amazing, particularly the gilded gold on the inside of the main mass area.

We came on Sunday during mass and had to wait outside for a bit while service was taking place. You can also go from the backside towards the inner chamber for a different look at the inside of the cathedral of underneath which was quite nice.

Holy sacred cathedral where construction began in 1175 dedicated to Saint John the Baptist.  The architecture is beautifully complimented by brilliant  colorful stained glass depicting various moments in Christianity.  The kaleidoscope of colors wash over your mind, body, and soul. The Grace of God fills every corner of the cathedral.

places.generalDescription: Place Bellecour is a vast and picturesque public square located in Lyon, France. It is known for its tree-lined avenues, flower stalls, and a small art museum. The square stretches from the lower part of the Presqu'ile between Lyon's two rivers to the Confluences area where the Rhone and Saone meet. It is considered Europe's largest square and features an impressive equestrian statue of Louis XIV.

sources.snippet:
Si vous aimez l'architecture, vous adorerez la place Bellecour, qui est la plus grande place de Lyon. Elle est entour√©e de b√¢timents de diff√©rents styles embl√©matiques de la ville de Lyon, dont
 l'h√¥tel de ville. La place est √©galement un endroit id√©al pour observer les gens et l'effervescence de la ville.
sources.shortName: Les 10 endroits les plus instagrammables √† lyon

sources.snippet: La Place Bellecour, l‚Äôune des plus grandes places de Lyon, est c√©l√®bre pour sa statue de Louis XIV et sa grande roue. Elle offre un cadre majestueux pour des photos embl√©matiques de Lyon et pour cause, elle est un des endroits les plus vus sur Instagram √† Lyon.
sources.shortName: Top 10 des Spots Instagrammables √† Lyon

sources.snippet: La place Bellecour offre √† la fois une jolie vue sur les hauteurs de Lyon et 62000 m2 d‚Äôespace pour des photos ¬´ seuls au monde¬ª. View this post on Instagram. A post shared by Valentin | PHOTOGRAPHE LYON (@_vb.photo_)
sources.shortName: Top 10 des lieux pour un shooting photo √† Lyon

places.name: Place Bellecour

reviews.text: Famous square in Lyon, quite big. There are some installations providing shadow and some areas with water drops making environment more fresh for the hot summer days. Really good idea and kids love it.

The square is very large and was pretty dusty and with next to no shade in the middle. I'm sure this space would be will use for events etc. Around the edges are yes lined walkways which was welcome in the summer heat. The Lyon tourism centre is here for those looking for help or interested in getting a city pass (you can pick them up here if you buy online). In one corner is the statue celebrating 'the Petit Prince'. There are also several fountains on one side which seemed very popular with young families looking to cool off.

Nice open hangout place in Lyon City center, Mersmerising views on all sides from the center, can walk from Perrache stop within 10 minutes or get the metro directly from anywhere in the city. Many public events are conducted here and definitely a place to be during festive evenings in lyon.

places.generalDescription: Perched on a hillside, the Gallo-Roman Museum of Lyon-Fourvi√®re offers a captivating journey through the city's ancient history. The museum boasts an extensive collection of art, pottery, and coins from the Roman era. Its audacious architecture provides a striking contrast between contemporary design and ornate Roman relics. Visitors can explore well-preserved ancient constructions such as the Roman Theatre, Odeon, and Roman Baths nearby.

sources.snippet: If Fourvi√®re‚Äôs extensive Roman ruins leave you thirsty for more ancient history, this modern museum is on site to give you some background. The building deserves a mention, as it‚Äôs partly underground and has been dug from the hillside next to the roman theatre. Futuristic, bunker-like galleries are arranged around a spiralling concrete ramp.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Lyon (France)

sources.snippet: Thanks to the country‚Äôs rich historical past, tourists have a lot to see in Lyon. The aforementioned theater on the Fourviere Hill also serves as a museum. The site, once occupied by the Roman settlement of Lugdun, now receives tourists from all over the world.
sources.shortName: Top 30 places to visit in Lyon in 2024 (Lots of photos)
The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Lyon

places.name: Gallo-Roman Museum of Lyon-Fourvi√®re

reviews.text: This was a fantastic museum for anyone with even a slight interest in history. Focused on the Roman Empire and how they founded what is now Lyon back in 43BC. The building itself is amazing. You street at the top which is basically chrome level and you work your way down over 5 levels. Plenty of space and really easy to move around. So many pieces to look at. I was surprised at how well preserved many of them were. Some good interactive sections specifically for kids were also good to see. We got an entry included in our Lyon city pass but considering the size of the museum the entry price is very good. Well worth going to see when you head up to the Basilica.

Very nice museum. The building itself is very interesting, built like a bunker. The contents are also very interesting there are a lot of really amazing artifacts. They have a lot of kid stuff so it seems to be one of the most family friendly museums I have seen. Would highly recommend visiting.
Water fountain with nice cold water on the 5th floor

What a surprisingly good museum in many stories. It was much larger that I expected. There are many, many objects that are exhibited very well thematically. Nice introductions to the different themes. And three wonderful Lego scenarios: the hippodrome, the Forum, and the Therme-quarter.

places.generalDescription: The Mus√©e des Confluences, located in Lyon, is a striking modern museum that opened in December 2014. It boasts a futuristic architectural design and is situated at the confluence of the Rhone and Saone rivers. The museum features both permanent and temporary exhibitions that delve into anthropology, natural science, and human history. Its iconic structure resembles a transparent crystal cloud made of stainless steel and glass.

sources.snippet: One of the most unique and imaginative buildings we‚Äôve seen in a long time, the spaceship-like Mus√©e des Confluences lies right at the southern tip of Presqu‚Äôile. Inside is just as thought-provoking as its four main exhibits cover the origins and meaning of life, different species and societies and various visions of the future. Set at the spot where the Rhone and Saone rivers meet, the museum was unveiled in 2014 as part of a larger urban renewal plan for the former industrial area.
sources.shortName: 18 Top Tourist Attractions in Lyon, France (+Map)

sources.snippet: Cette structure de b√©ton, de verre et d‚Äôacier est parfaite pour r√©inventer l‚Äôunivers monochrome. Inaugur√© en 2014, le mus√©e des Confluences est l‚Äôendroit id√©al pour des photos √† deux, en famille et m√™me des photos professionnelles. Vous pourrez poser sur les marches du jardin, sous les arches brutes, ou devant l‚ÄôOctopus, son container jaune poussin pour des photos tout en contraste.
sources.shortName: Top 10 des lieux pour un shooting photo √† Lyon

sources.snippet: Si il raconte l‚Äôhistoire de l‚ÄôHomme et du vivant, Le Mus√©e des Confluences inaugur√© en 2014 est un v√©ritable chef d‚Äô≈ìuvre architectural. Sa structure faite de verre, d‚Äôinox et de b√©ton en fait un v√©ritable symbole de la ville. En fonction de l‚Äôheure et de la lumi√®re, vous pourrez peut-√™tre m√™me apercevoir sa r√©flexion sur le Rh√¥ne.
sources.shortName: 10 des endroits les plus instagrammables de Lyon

sources.snippet: Le Mus√©e des Confluences est le mus√©e d‚Äôhistoires naturelles et des civilisations de la ville. Il a vu le jour en 2014, dans le quartier de Confluence, sur la pointe sud de la Presqu‚Äô√Æle de Lyon, au confluent du Rh√¥ne et de la Sa√¥ne. On ne va pas vous mentir, nous ne sommes jamais rentr√©s √† l‚Äôint√©rieur du mus√©e.
sources.shortName: Lyon : nos 10 spots photos favoris

sources.snippet: An eye-catching ultra-modern building provides the exhibit space for this comprehensive and cutting-edge museum. The museum displays collections of natural science, natural history, archaeology, and anthropology. The natural science department includes minerals, shells, zoology, and entomology sections.
sources.shortName: Attractions & Places to Visit in Lyon

sources.snippet: Le mus√©e des Confluences est un v√©ritable chef-d'≈ìuvre architectural. Il a √©t√© inaugur√© en 2014 et sa structure faite de verre, d'acier inoxydable et de b√©ton en fait un symbole de la ville. Selon l'heure de la journ√©e et la lumi√®re du soleil, vous pourrez peut-√™tre voir son reflet sur le Rh√¥ne.
sources.shortName: Les 10 endroits les plus instagrammables √† lyon

sources.snippet: So far, we‚Äôve seen (and taken pictures of) a lot of incredible Gothic and Renaissance architecture in Lyon. But Lyon has some architectural surprises up its sleeve!. You‚Äôll find many ultra-modern buildings in Lyon, making for some interesting visual contrasts of old and new.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Lyon Instagram Spots: Perfect Lyon Photos (2025)

sources.snippet: On a la chance d‚Äôavoir l‚Äôun des mus√©es les plus architecturalement spectaculaires √† Lyon, il serait donc dommage de ne pas en profiter. En plus d‚Äôoffrir une programmation hyper qualitative, le mus√©e des Confluences fait litt√©ralement rayonner la pointe sud de la Presqu‚Äô√Æle.
sources.shortName: Top des plus beaux spots √† d√©couvrir absolument √† Lyon

sources.snippet: Situ√© √† la confluence du Rh√¥ne et de la Sa√¥ne, le Mus√©e des Confluences se fait remarquer par son architecture avant-gardiste. Ce mus√©e est un carrefour o√π art, science et histoire se rejoignent, offrant des points de vue photographiques sans pareils.
sources.shortName: Les 10 Meilleurs Spots pour Prendre des Photos √† Lyon

sources.snippet: The Mus√©e des Confluences has a breathtaking view over Lyon. To do so, take a step up. On the roof of the museum, the terrace offers an exceptional panoramic view of Lyon and the surrounding area, with the Alps and Mont Blanc as a highlight.
sources.shortName: Lyon‚Äôs best viewpoints - Lyon Tourist Office

sources.snippet: On ne pouvait pas ignorer le quartier de la Confluence dans ce top 10. Direction le mus√©e et son architecture atypique. Ici √ßa sera un th√®me tr√®s street.
sources.shortName: Lieux instagrammables √† Lyon : le parcours en 10 √©tapes

sources.snippet: Quoi de mieux pour donner un c√¥t√© artistique √† son feed instagram que de prendre une photo devant un mus√©e ?. Pas n‚Äôimporte lequel !
sources.shortName: Top 15 des Meilleurs Spots pour un Shooting Photo √† Lyon

places.name: Mus√©e des Confluences

reviews.text: This is a very well done Natural History Museum. Pe visited when there was a special exhibition on sleep and dreams which was very interesting. The Architecture is stunning how many interior is delightful. Don't forget to go to the top floor and have a cafe. Underground floor is you exit there is a high-end restaurant set off by several large pools water.

Many interesting exhibitions inside, awesome building outside. The park area needs a little maintenance and upkeep, but everything else is great! The exhibitions were varied and interesting, I can see myself going back whenever new ones open up. I did expect a little more when it came to anthropological exhibitions. But maybe I missed that part, couldn't finish the whole thing in one afternoon.

This might be one of the best modern museums I went to, really! It's very complete and I think kids would love it- there were a lot of enthusiastic ones when we went, at least.
Their permanent expositions are very well detailed and easy to navigate, they're mostly about natural history, anthropology and culture, not much art history, or at least I didn't find one. Everything has french and english explications. On the entrance to each permanent exposition, there was a guide who would give a general feel of the pieces, and they could speak English too!
Their temporary expositions were interesting and very well done, we went to the Amazon and the dreams ones, both very interesting. We didn't have to pay extra for these.
They had elevators for all stages, and there were a lot of audio explanations too.
On the terrace there was a lovely - albeit a bit expensive - cafe, with nice views. If you're not hungry, the terrace is included on the ticket price anyway, so you should go at least for the view.
A must see in Lyon, for sure!

places.generalDescription: Jardin des Curiosit√©s, also known as Jardin du Belvedere or Jardin de Montreal, is a 6,000 square meter green space located in Lyon's fifth district. Perched on the heights of Saint-Just, this park offers a magnificent panoramic view of the city and the Sa√¥ne river. It is a popular spot for locals to relax and enjoy picnics with friends.

sources.snippet: Perch√© sur les hauteurs de Saint-Just (5e arrondissement), le jardin des curiosit√©s est un lieu ‚Äúsecret‚Äù situ√© au bout de la place de l‚Äôabb√© Larue. C‚Äôest un endroit tr√®s pris√© des Lyonnais et plut√¥t m√©connu des touristes. Pour l‚Äôanecdote, il a √©t√© offert par la ville de Montr√©al pour c√©l√©brer le vingti√®me anniversaire des relations de coop√©ration avec Lyon et l‚Äôon y trouve de nombreux clins d‚Äôoeil √† la belle ville canadienne.
sources.shortName: Lyon : nos 10 spots photos favoris

sources.snippet:
C'est un petit coin de verdure avec une vue imprenable sur la ville. Lorsque le soleil se couche et jette sa lumi√®re dor√©e sur les toits de la ville, c'est un
 spectacle vraiment magnifique. Ce jardin paisible est un pr√©sent offert par la ville de Montr√©al, symbole du jumelage entre les deux villes depuis de nombreuses ann√©es.Un endroit confidentiel
 tr√®s peu connu des touristes o√π vous pouvez prendre de superbes photos.
sources.shortName: Les 10 endroits les plus instagrammables √† lyon

sources.snippet: Ce jardin magnifique et sa vue √©poustouflante sont bien √©videmment parmi les must de la ville. Offert par la ville de Montr√©al pour c√©l√©brer la coop√©ration entre les deux villes, le Jardin des Curiosit√© est aussi appel√© Jardin de Montr√©al. Son panorama vous offrira une vue sur les toits lyonnais tout en profitant d‚Äôune pause du rythme fr√©n√©tique de la ville.
sources.shortName: 10 des endroits les plus instagrammables de Lyon

sources.snippet: Jardin aussi d√©nomm√© ¬´ Jardin de Montr√©al ¬ª, il est situ√© vers Saint-Just. Peu connu, il offre le double avantage d‚Äôune vue √©poustouflante sur Lyon, et d‚Äô√™tre beaucoup moins touristique que d‚Äôautres points de vue comme la Basilique Notre-Dame-de-Fourvi√®re. L‚Äôendroit id√©al pour quelques sublimes clich√©s lors d‚Äôun shooting photo de mariage √† Lyon.
sources.shortName: Top 10 des lieux pour un shooting photo √† Lyon

sources.snippet: The Jardin des Curiosit√©s actually is quite a secret place in Lyon, and surprisingly, many Lyonnais don‚Äôt know it. However, it offers one of the best views of Lyon you can get, and its remoteness makes it a perfect place to chill with friends in the long summer evenings. Lyon, France : View from Jardin des Curiosit√©s on a cloudy day
sources.shortName: The 5 Best views and viewpoints in Lyon, France ‚Äì where to take incredible photos of sunrise and sunset

sources.snippet: Une publication partag√©e par ùïÅùï¶ùïùùïöùïñùïü ùïÉ‚Äô‚Ñçùïñùï£ùï£ùï†ùïü (@julien_l_h). Attention les yeux, voici un des spots qui offre l‚Äôune des plus belles vues sur la ville !. Perch√© sur les hauteurs de Fourvi√®re, le Jardin des Curiosit√©s nous donne l‚Äôimpression de dominer la ville surplombant les toits lyonnais.
sources.shortName: Lyon : 22 spots photos instagrammables

sources.snippet: C‚Äôest l‚Äôun des autres spots qui offre une vue panoramique sur la ville. A l‚Äôinstar de l‚Äôesplanade de Fourvi√®re, le Jardin des Curiosit√©s nous donne de la hauteur pour dominer les toits lyonnais. Mais en plus de √ßa, le spot est ultra-romantique avec ses arbres, ses bancs et son sol d‚Äôocre.

Nice view but not like amazing, dogs not allowed which kinda sucks

places.generalDescription: The Place des Terreaux is a large public plaza in Lyons, France that is famous for its architecture and its famous fountain. The site has been in use since the 13th century and has seen a lot of history, most notably during the French Revolution when it was used for beheadings. Today, the square is bordered by Lyon City Hall to the east and the Museum of Fine Arts of Lyon on the south.

sources.snippet:
La place des Terreaux est une place du 1er arrondissement de Lyon, en France. Elle est situ√©e au pied de la colline de la Croix-Rousse, entre le Rh√¥ne et la Sa√¥ne, et est entour√©e de deux
 monuments importants : L'h√¥tel de ville √† l'est et le mus√©e des Beaux-Arts au sud. La fontaine Bartholdi est aussi √† d√©couvrir dans cet espace cher aux Lyonnais.
sources.shortName: Les 10 endroits les plus instagrammables √† lyon

sources.snippet: This World Heritage UNESCO site lights up at night to serve some of the best Lyon looks you‚Äôll ever see. Day or night, though, we‚Äôre not picking sides. Places des Tereaux is Instagrammable at any hour of the day.
sources.shortName: The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Lyon

places.name: Place des Terreaux

reviews.text: Really pretty. Could spend half an hour just to sit here.
A bit quiet around this time as still in winter.  Infirmary no fountain or water

Place des Terreaux is one of Lyon's most vibrant and historically rich squares, nestled between the H√¥tel de Ville (City Hall) and the Mus√©e des Beaux-Arts. With its lively atmosphere, striking architecture, and cultural significance, it's a natural gathering spot and a favorite among both locals and visitors.

At the heart of the square stands the dramatic Bartholdi Fountain, a masterpiece of bronze sculpture featuring a chariot pulled by four wild horses-designed by the same artist who created the Statue of Liberty. The fountain alone is worth the visit, offering a powerful sense of movement and expression.

places.generalDescription: The Mur des Canuts, located on the Boulevard des Canuts in Lyon's Croix Rousse district, is a massive mural that showcases the history of the neighborhood, once inhabited by silk weavers known as canuts. Painted in trompe-l'oeil style, it seamlessly integrates with its surroundings. Initially created in 1987, this mural has been periodically updated to reflect changes to nearby structures.

sources.snippet: Located on the Boulevard des Canuts in the Croix Rousse district, this expansive mural depicts the heritage of the neighborhood that was once home to the city‚Äôs many silk weavers, or canuts. Painted in the trompe-l‚Äôoeil style, the scenes illustrated in the mammoth fresco blend in seamlessly with their surroundings, challenging viewers to examine the line between art and reality. First painted in 1987, the largest mural in Europe has been revised several times to reflect changes made to the nearby structures and has become a popular tourist attractions in Lyon.
sources.shortName: 18 Top Tourist Attractions in Lyon, France (+Map)

sources.snippet: Europe‚Äôs largest mural is located in Lyon, and it‚Äôs a great spot for your next Instagram post. : Mur des Canuts is a big-ass painted wall that represents life in the working class area known as Croix-Rousse. : Follow the same route that got you to Rue Jos√©phin Soulary and then open up Google Maps on your phone.
sources.shortName: The Best Lyon Instagram Spots

sources.snippet: For a unique piece of street art and a history lesson all in one, head to the Mur des Canuts. This colorful mural commemorates Lyon‚Äôs silk workers and is located in the Croix-Rousse neighborhood. The Mur des Canuts is one of Lyon‚Äôs amazing trompe-l‚Äôoeil murals.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Lyon Instagram Spots: Perfect Lyon Photos (2025)

sources.snippet: Le Mur des Canuts, la plus grande fresque murale d‚ÄôEurope, est un incontournable pour les amateurs de street art. Ses d√©tails r√©alistes et son √©chelle impressionnante en font un fond id√©al pour des photos saisissantes.
sources.shortName: Top 10 des Spots Instagrammables √† Lyon

places.name: Mur des Canuts

reviews.text:
The Mur des Canuts is one of Lyon's most striking and imaginative landmarks-a massive mural that blurs the line between reality and art. Located in the Croix-Rousse district, this incredible trompe-l'≈ìil (trick of the eye) painting spans an entire building fa√ßade and captures the spirit of the neighborhood's history and daily life with astonishing detail.

From a distance, you might mistake it for an actual street scene. Windows, staircases, balconies, people chatting-everything is painted so realistically that it feels like the wall itself is alive. The mural pays tribute to the Canuts, Lyon's 19th-century silk workers, while also evolving over time to reflect the neighborhood's modern character.
Definitely worth the short walk from La Maison des Canute! Amazing the perspective of the mural and it's size

A lovely mural that is extensively detailed. I've heard that the mural is occasionally touched up to age the people in it, which is great attention to detail. We enjoyed checking this out and looking closely at the different parts of it!

places.generalDescription: The Op√©ra National de Lyon is a grand neo-Renaissance opera house located in the heart of Lyon. Its historic facade, adorned with ornate columns and arched entryways, sets the stage for the opulent interior featuring gilded decorations and plush velvet seating. The magnificent auditorium can accommodate over 1,000 patrons. Architect Jean Nouvel's reconstruction in the early 90s preserved the original facade from 1831 while adding a huge cylindrical canopy that now defines its iconic appearance.

sources.snippet: Situ√© sur la presqu‚Äô√Æle lyonnaise class√©e au patrimoine mondial de l‚ÄôUNESCO, l‚ÄôOp√©ra de Lyon sur la place de l‚ÄôH√¥tel de Ville m√©rite aussi sa place dans votre feed. Construit en 1831, il a √©t√© enti√®rement r√©nov√© en 1989 par le c√©l√®bre architecte Jean Nouvel. Vos followers vous envieront sans aucun doute sa grande verri√®re qui t√©moigne de son architecture hybride, combinant l‚Äôancien et le moderne.
sources.shortName: 10 des endroits les plus instagrammables de Lyon

sources.snippet: Allegorically speaking, the Opera de Lyon is the soul of hospitable Lyon. Today its cohesive team includes ballet and opera companies, an opera chorus and a symphony orchestra. The modern theater bears the name of the architect who designed the building - Jacques Nouvel.
sources.shortName: Top 30 places to visit in Lyon in 2024 (Lots of photos)

sources.snippet: To make sure visiting friends and family speak in glowing terms about their last stay in Lyon (and hence about you), you can impress them by picking a spot to see the city by night!

places.name: Op√©ra National de Lyon

reviews.text: Went for a free concert from the students of the conservatoire. It was splendid. 45 minutes of percussions and just a music splurge , adding the warmth in the winter, cannot wait to return. Receptions are friendly, toilets are clean. While waiting we went to the cafe opposite to get a good look on the beautiful building on a winter evening.

Wonderful place, great architecture and design.
Had the chance to attend an opera inside too, prices were a bit high but the experience worths it.
You can buy online or at the place. Balcony seats were just fine if you got the best angle!

I have been to Lyon a few times and can never imagine the interior of this building from outside. In addition, this is another work by Jean Nouvel (difficult to tell from the outside). Black and red set up a club feel under historical facets. It's quite small so it's OK to have a seat on the balcony. The foyer is very pleasant and you can have a drink. The staff is exceptionally nice.

places.address: 1 Pl. de la Com√©die, 69001 Lyon, France

places.generalDescription: The H√¥tel de Ville de Lyon is a beautiful building with impressive architecture from the 17th century. It now serves as the city hall in Lyon. The building is very lively in the evening with all the illumination, and it is a must-go destination if you are in Lyon.

sources.snippet: The H√¥tel de Ville, or City Hall, is an exquisite example of neo-renaissance architecture at its finest. Located in the 4th arrondissement, this building is not only the administrative heart of Paris but also a striking backdrop for photography. Its ornate exterior, featuring sculptures, reliefs, and a grand square, has witnessed many of Paris‚Äôs pivotal moments.
sources.shortName: Instagram Photo Spots in Paris

sources.snippet: The H√¥tel de Ville de Lyon is a grand building in the infamous Place des Terreaux. The most common photo you‚Äôll see of this spot is taken next to the Bartholdi Fountain. But, in my opinion, it doesn‚Äôt do the building justice.
sources.shortName: 22 Captivating Lyon Instagram Spots (2025)

places.name: H√¥tel de Ville de Lyon

reviews.text: A beautiful town hall in Lyon, France. We loved our visit. The architecture is just stunning. It is located in a beautiful square with an amazing fountain and other beautiful buildings. Very historical.

The H√¥tel de Ville de Lyon, or Lyon City Hall, is one of the city's most impressive architectural landmarks-grand, historic, and perfectly situated between Place des Terreaux and the Op√©ra de Lyon. Built in the 17th century and later restored after a fire, this building is a showcase of French Baroque elegance and civic pride.

Its ornate fa√ßade, intricate sculptures, and imposing bell tower make it a standout feature of central Lyon. Every detail, from the symmetrical windows to the sculpted allegories and coats of arms, reflects the building's historic importance and artistic richness. It's especially stunning when illuminated at night, casting a golden glow over the square.
Delightful architecture and so really accessible to the public.  I popped into a small courtyard space by chance to find a ribbed ceiling and what would have been s nice space to chill out!

places.address: 1 Pl. de la Com√©die, 69001 Lyon, France

places.generalDescription: Jardin des Chartreux - Clos St Beno√Æt is a bustling 1-hectare park created in the 19th century, offering paths and sweeping views of Lyon. It features a terrace that provides superb panoramic views across Lyon, including the district of Fourvi√®re. The park is located near Place Rouville and is known for its stunning sunset views, with the setting sun reflecting in InCity Tower.

sources.snippet: Jardin des Chartreux is located near Place Rouville, which also offers a great view of Lyon. This little park, which is often desert, is one of the best places to enjoy Lyon at sunset, when the setting sun reflects in InCity Tower. Lyon, France : View from Jardin des Chartreux at sunset
sources.shortName: The 5 Best views and viewpoints in Lyon, France ‚Äì where to take incredible photos of sunrise and sunset

sources.snippet: L‚Äôune des meilleures vues de Lyon, et l‚Äôune des plus secr√®tes et romantiques, est celle que vous verrez depuis le Jardin des Chartreux, sur la colline de Croix-Rousse.

Lovely view of Lyon from this place.
It's especially beautiful when it's sunny.
I like going there with a coffee and enjoying the view
Beautiful night view of the Lyon

Lovely view.. nice place for chilling and relaxing over a BBQ and drink.
Oh yea they do organize a music festival over there live bands play each July.

places.generalDescription: The Fresque des Lyonnais, also known as the Mural of the Lyonnais, is a magnificent trompe l'oeil painting that graces the exterior of a building in Lyon. This impressive artwork, created by renowned artist Raymond Moretti in 1995, showcases 30 influential and celebrated figures from the city's history.

sources.snippet: Picture this: you‚Äôre strolling down the streets of Lyon and you turn a corner to find a mural so realistic, it‚Äôs as if you‚Äôve walked into a living, breathing scene from the city‚Äôs past and present. One such stunner is the Fresque des Lyonnais, a towering marvel of urban street art looming at seven stories high. This fabulous fresque brings Lyon‚Äôs illustrious residents to life ‚Äì from the brothers Lumi√®re, pioneers of cinema, to silk weaver Laurent Mourguet, creator of the famous Guignol puppet.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Lyon Instagram Spots: Perfect Lyon Photos (2025)

sources.snippet: Along with the Mur des Canuts, the Fresque des Lyonnais is one of the city‚Äôs biggest and best-loved public art pieces. Overlooking the tranquil Saone River, the enormous trompe-l‚Äôoeil painting depicts thirty famous people from throughout Lyon‚Äôs more than 2,000 years of history. Painted in the mid-nineties by the CiteCreation cooperative of artists, the colourful work covers two windowless sides of a large building located not far from Place des Terreaux.
sources.shortName: 18 Top Tourist Attractions in Lyon, France (+Map)

sources.snippet: The Fresque des Lyonnais is one of the most celebrated artworks in Lyon. It was commissioned by the city in the mid-1990s and completed by a talented collective known as Cit√© de la Cr√©ation. The mural contains 30 portraits of historical figures, masterfully painted in exquisite detail.
sources.shortName: 22 Captivating Lyon Instagram Spots (2025)

places.name: Fresque des Lyonnais

reviews.text: We did a nice walk along the Sa√¥ne River to this fantastic public art homage to the great personalities of Lyon.
We were walking and we've seen it. It was pretty impressive and make you feel in the old time

This mural of famous Lyonnaise people looking out of windows is captivating.

The world would be a better place if every city showed some pride in its famous sons and daughters and had a mural this.

places.address: 2 Rue de la Martini√®re, 69001 Lyon, France

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the vibrant Croix-Rousse district of Lyon, the Traboule et Cour des Voraces is a captivating urban passageway that beckons explorers and photographers alike. Dating back to around 1840, this unique location features an impressive six-story staircase and showcases stunning street art that adds a modern twist to its historical charm. Originally designed as sheltered routes for silk merchants to protect their delicate goods from inclement weather, these traboules have evolved into intriguing spots filled with stories of the past.

sources.snippet: Throughout La Croix-Rousse district of Lyon, there are a maze of well over a hundred covered and secret passages known as the ‚Äòtraboules‚Äô of Lyon. These were spaces used by silk merchants to keep their products dry when the weather was a little worse for the wear and the delicate silks were at risk of water damage. Today, Cour des Voraces is one of the most impressive and well-recognised of these traboules, in thanks part to its featuring in several movies and television series over the years.
sources.shortName: Hiden gems & secret spots in Lyon the locals don't know about

sources.snippet: The Cour des Voraces is one of Lyon‚Äôs famed traboules, tucked away in the Croix-Rousse district. This one was a little hard for me to find with my friend Google Maps (I have a terrible sense of direction). While the traboules in Vieux Lyon generally feature warm reddish tones and eye-catching Renaissance architecture, the Cour des Voraces is a no-frills building in monochrome gray.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Lyon Instagram Spots: Perfect Lyon Photos (2025)

sources.snippet: T√©moin de la folle histoire des Canuts, la Cour des Voraces a su traverser les d√©cennies sans prendre une seule ride et perdre de sa superbe. Ses escaliers s‚Äôimbriquant √† merveille offrent une perspective unique et une composition urbaine inestimable. Pour les traboules, il y en a plus de 400 √† Lyon, alors t√¢chez de ne pas immortaliser la m√™me que tout le monde‚Ä¶
sources.shortName: Top des plus beaux spots √† d√©couvrir absolument √† Lyon

sources.snippet: The staircase in the photo above is part of a series of passageways called Cour des Voraces. It‚Äôs also the oldest in Lyon. It was definitely not the most beautiful staircase I had seen.
sources.shortName: 22 Captivating Lyon Instagram Spots (2025)

places.name: Traboule et Cour des Voraces

reviews.text:
Visiting Traboule et Cour des Voraces was a captivating experience. Hidden away in Lyon, this architectural gem left me in awe. The spectacular design features a historic six-story staircase used by silk workers in the 19th century. Its unique, hidden nature adds to the charm, making it feel like a secret passage through history.
The intricate stonework and historical significance make it a fascinating spot to explore and appreciate Lyon's architectural heritage.
Cool stairs. Interesting story. Lots of graffiti around. It's an interesting stop if you are into photography or local history, but I would not recommend going out of your way to visit. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
Traboule et Cour des Voraces is such a cool spot. Perfect for photography. The stairs and the old vibe make it feel really unique.

sources.snippet: Suspendue au-dessus du Rh√¥ne, la passerelle du Coll√®ge fut construite en 1845 une petite ann√©e apr√®s qu‚Äôun drame ne survienne sur le chantier, provoquant la mort de 8 ouvriers. Le c√¥t√© glauque mis de c√¥t√©, la passerelle du Coll√®ge rayonne aujourd‚Äôhui sur la ville et offre aux photographes du dimanche un spot unique de clich√©.
sources.shortName: Top des plus beaux spots √† d√©couvrir absolument √† Lyon

sources.snippet: The river crosses the city a lot, so there are many beautiful bridge there. For this one, you can walk down under it, and get a view of it in its fullest. There are not many ships going up and down the river, so you will also get a great reflection there.
sources.shortName: Top photography spots - Lyon, France

reviews.text: A picturesque pedestrian bridge with stunning views of the Rh√¥ne River. The historic design adds a charming touch, making it a perfect spot for a peaceful walk or to take photos. Great connection between the city center and Parc de la T√™te d'Or. A must-see for anyone visiting Lyon!

It is a very nice bridge for it is possible to behold the Rhone river very peacefully, wind sometimes rocks the bridge and the structure squeaks a little, it sounds frightening when one hears it by the very first time yet the structure is very safe and I found it amusing at the end of the day; the view is beautiful and snapshots are too. Very recommendable place to spend some time in peaceful contemplation.

Nice old suspension bridge. Calmly swings sometimes - under the heavy bikers :)
If you walk around the "Terreaux bat de Argent" district this is a must go {through}!

places.generalDescription: Les Traboules du Vieux Lyon, often referred to as the Secret Passageways of Old Lyon, are a fascinating maze of covered walkways that weave through the city's historic Renaissance district. Dating back to the 4th century, these unique passages were initially designed to offer residents sheltered routes between their homes and the bustling River Sa√¥ne. Over time, they adapted to various needs‚Äîserving as safe havens during turbulent times and facilitating trade in silk when Lyon thrived as a production center.

sources.snippet: In Vieux Lyon and La Croix-Rousse Sa√¥ne are an architectural feature unique to this city: Traboules are delightful renaissance passageways, some 40 of which are open to the public, running beneath buildings in the direction of the Sa√¥ne River. They gave the city‚Äôs silk workers direct access to riverbank, making it quick and easy to transport textiles, while also offering shelter from the elements. Nearly all of these passageways are part of residential properties, so it‚Äôs a good idea to go quietly.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Lyon (France)

sources.snippet: The historic center of Lyon, in addition to its architectural monuments, is memorable to tourists for its special ancient streets called traboules. This is a typically Lyon term referring to a narrow through corridor cutting through several consecutive buildings to connect a series of city streets. It can be both a covered gallery and an open-air alley.
sources.shortName: Top 30 places to visit in Lyon in 2024 (Lots of photos)

sources.snippet: Les traboules, ces passages secrets qui serpentent √† travers le Vieux Lyon, sont un incontournable pour tout instagrammeur. Leur charme historique et leur atmosph√®re myst√©rieuse offrent un cadre unique pour des photos pleines de caract√®re.
sources.shortName: Top 10 des Spots Instagrammables √† Lyon

places.name: Traboules du Vieux Lyon

reviews.text: So beautiful ! It is not crowded like Paris but has all the charm.. very easy to get around especially for first time tourist‚Ä¶ easily to get around within 15 minutes everywhere.. so many Michilin star restaurant as well as local favorite eatery!!!
Beautiful city and street. Every steps on the street made me heaven.
The traboules of Lyon were my favourite sights of the city. I enjoyed learning about their history from medieval times to the WW2 resistance. They are so unique and useful.

places.generalDescription: Jardin Rosa Mir is a hidden gem located in the La Croix-Rousse district of Lyon. Created by Jules Senis, a tiler and bricklayer, between 1957 and 1977, this secret landscaped garden features mosaic walls adorned with seashells and stones. Covering only 400 square meters, it has been awarded 20th Century Heritage status due to its unique design.

sources.snippet: Open only during the summer months and situated in La Croix-Rousse district, the mosaic garden of the oh-so-trendy 4th arrondissement of the city was created by tiler and bricklayer, Jules Senis. Created between 1957 and 1977, the impressive artwork is a multi-level garden hidden away from the street. Easily one of the most unusual things to do in Lyon, Jardin Rosa Mir is characterised by the many-layered structures surrounding flower border beds, which also renders this hidden gem a great photo spot.
sources.shortName: Hiden gems & secret spots in Lyon the locals don't know about

places.generalDescription: The Grandes Serres du Parc de la T√™te d'Or offer a unique tropical oasis in the heart of the city. The symmetrical architecture outside gives way to a lush jungle inside, creating a captivating atmosphere where plants seem to dance with sunlight. Visitors can enjoy free access to these well-maintained and diverse greenhouses, which provide an immersive experience regardless of the weather outside.

sources.snippet: Au cours d‚Äôune balade au coeur de la verdure du Parc de la T√™te d‚ÄôOr, la serre offre un d√©cor tropical compl√®tement improbable en plein centre ville. A l‚Äôext√©rieur, le b√¢timent dispose d‚Äôune architecture toute en sym√©trie; tandis qu‚Äô√† l‚Äôint√©rieur, c‚Äôest la jungle qui vous enlace dans ses bras verdoyants.

reviews.text: Calling it a park is an understatement; it's a beautiful place where man and nature meet.
Free admission and a must-see should you like the flora as it has a great number of tropical plants and amongst the biggest strelizia plants I've ever seen, talling ~5 meters.
